item.title: Making fire with two pieces of sticks; and tinder-making
item.summary: Making fire with two pieces of stick. By /han≠kass’o (L VIII. -28. 8471 and 8472). The people make fire (when they have no tinderbox) using two pieces of stick (from a divided arrow). The tree used for tinder is a dry Doornboom (thorn tree) that lies dead on the ground.
item.comments: 1) p.8470v: |han≠kass'o experienced this himself: his maternal grandfather (Tsatsi) made fire this way when he had no tinder, 2) p.8472v: all |xam have 'European' tinderboxes according to |han≠kass'o, 3) This story is found in Book VIII-28
item.author: |han≠kass'o (Klein Jantje) (VIII)
